alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 03 at 9:14PM AKDT until November 06 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Northeast winds 40 to 60 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From late Friday night through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A somewhat early season wind event will set up from Thompson Pass down through Valdez. Northeast winds will start during the day Friday and remain gusty through Saturday night. The strongest period looks to be Saturday afternoon. While the highest sustained winds are likely to be through Thompson Pass, gusts to 80 mph will be possible in both the Pass and in town.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
